member.name: M:DG.DemiEditor.DeEditorFileUtils.GUIDToExistingAssetPath(System.String)

member.name: T:DG.DemiEditor.DeEditorPanelUtils
member.summary: Utilities for Editor Panels.

member.name: M:DG.DemiEditor.DeEditorPanelUtils.ConnectToSourceAsset``1(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Connects to a asset. If the asset already exists at the given path, loads it and returns it. Otherwise, depending on the given parameters, either returns NULL or automatically creates it before loading and returning it.
member.param: File path (relative to Unity's project folder)
If TRUE and the requested asset doesn't exist, forces its creation

member.name: T:DG.DemiEditor.DeGUIDrag
member.summary: Manages the dragging of GUI elements

member.name: P:DG.DemiEditor.DeGUIDrag.isDragging
member.summary: True if a GUI element is currently being dragged

member.name: P:DG.DemiEditor.DeGUIDrag.draggedItem
member.summary: Return the current item being dragged, or NULL if there is none

member.name: P:DG.DemiEditor.DeGUIDrag.draggedItemType
member.summary: Type of current item being dragged, or NULL if there is none

member.name: P:DG.DemiEditor.DeGUIDrag.draggedItemOriginalIndex
member.summary: Starting index of current item being dragged, or NULL if there is none

member.name: P:DG.DemiEditor.DeGUIDrag.optionalDragData
member.summary: Retrieves the eventual optional data stored via the StartDrag method

member.name: M:DG.DemiEditor.DeGUIDrag.StartDrag(System.Int32,UnityEditor.Editor,System.Collections.IList,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts a drag operation on a GUI element.
member.param: ID for this drag operation (must be the same for both StartDrag and Drag
Reference to the current editor drawing the GUI (used when a Repaint is needed)
List containing the dragged item and all other relative draggable items
DraggableList index of the item being dragged
Optional data that can be retrieved via the static property

member.name: M:DG.DemiEditor.DeGUIDrag.StartDrag(System.Int32,UnityEditor.EditorWindow,System.Collections.IList,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts a drag operation on a GUI element.
member.param: ID for this drag operation (must be the same for both StartDrag and Drag
Reference to the current editor drawing the GUI (used when a Repaint is needed)
List containing the dragged item and all other relative draggable items
DraggableList index of the item being dragged
Optional data that can be retrieved via the static property

member.name: M:DG.DemiEditor.DeGUIDrag.Drag(System.Int32,System.Collections.IList,System.Int32)
member.summary: Call this after each draggable GUI block, to calculate and draw the current drag state (or complete it if the mouse was released). Returns TRUE if the drag operation was concluded and accepted.
member.param: ID for this drag operation (must be the same for both StartDrag and Drag
List containing the draggable item and all other relative draggable items
Current index of the draggable item being drawn

member.name: M:DG.DemiEditor.DeGUIDrag.Drag(System.Int32,System.Collections.IList,System.Int32,UnityEngine.Color)
member.summary: Call this after each draggable GUI block, to calculate and draw the current drag state (or complete it if the mouse was released). Returns TRUE if the drag operation was concluded and accepted.
member.param: ID for this drag operation (must be the same for both StartDrag and Drag
List containing the draggable item and all other relative draggable items
Current index of the draggable item being drawn
Color to use for drag divider and selection

member.name: M:DG.DemiEditor.DeGUIDrag.EndDrag(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Ends the drag operations, and eventually applies the drag result. Returns TRUE if the position of the dragged item actually changed. Called automatically by Drag method. Use it only if you want to force the end of a drag operation.
member.param: If TRUE applies the drag results, otherwise simply cancels the drag

member.name: T:DG.DemiEditor.DeStylePalette
member.summary: Stores a GUIStyle palette, which can be passed to default DeGUI layouts when calling DeGUI.BeginGUI, and changed at any time by calling DeGUI.ChangePalette. You can inherit from this class to create custom GUIStyle palettes with more options. Each of the sub-options require a public Init method to initialize the styles, which will be called via Reflection.

member.name: M:DG.DemiEditor.DeStylePalette.Init
member.summary: Called automatically by DeGUI.BeginGUI. Override when adding new style subclasses.

member.name: T:DG.DemiEditor.DeStyleSubPalette
member.summary: Extend any custom subpalettes from this, so they will be initialized correctly
